title: Major Incident Management
text: table of contents definition declaring a major incident managing a major incident process diagram major incident log major incident manager instructions communication during the incident major incident report (story telling after the incident) key contacts for major incident managers definition major incidents are where multiple stores or multiple customers are experiencing a p1 caused by the same underlying issue. if there is only one customer affected by the same issue, please follow how to handle a p1. if it is a major incident: it is likely there is a financial impact on multiple customers i.e. affecting customers' immediate ability to trade, it could be a whole service being down (e.g. imagine). a major incident might also be declared if there is a potential significant financial impact on k3 because it may result in k3 having to pay compensation, or losing one or more major customers. declaring a major incident support receives a phone-call for a p1 incident (p1s should be raised by phone, but may be raised via other channels) support logs ticket and does initial triage. if triage reveals that one or more services are down (could happen for a p2 which you realise needs to be changed to a p1), or there is a performance issue so severe that effectively a service is down (i.e. multiple customers affected), create a tracker ticket and notify the major incident manager (mim) the mim will be the support manager for the region, or the most available support manager - uk: richard; europe: odd - if richard or odd is on holiday or not available/contactable (e.g. due to being on a customer site), then contact the manager who is available - if a mi occurs near the end of the european normal working hours, then it would usually make more sense for richard to be the mim if both odd and richard are available if further details are required to determine if it's a mi, mim asks support for further troubleshooting / info from customer. mim declares a major incident if appropriate and creates an internal master-ticket (which must be in english) managing a major incident if a major incident is declared, whoever is best to investigate/resolve the problem must drop their other work and work on this 100% until it is resolved this includes people from all teams in retail solutions all other tickets should be opened (per customer) and linked to the master problem ticket. mim starts a teams-chat with involved support and other staff trying to resolve the issue, and names it with the ticket number and product (e.g. k3cs-12345 imagine") mim provides management/stakeholder updates as per mim instructions below the impact and troubleshooting steps must be clear from the ticket description (see general ticket management) if support determines that help is required from other teams, dm will contact personnel for the appropriate product (see key contacts for duty managers) when you forward a major incident to a new function, they must be notified via chat or call and acknowledge ownership. if cross-team internal collaboration is required - mim will add them to the teams-chat and may set up and chair a taskforce meeting. actions must be documented concisely in teams-chat made and may be included and sent out to the retail solutions management team in the next update. when incident is resolved, mim ensures the ticket is closed mim declares major incident over and informs all parties within 1 week, mim writes and populates the master ticket with incident report. (can be done in resolved status) as soon as possible after the incident report, a root cause analysis and how we will prevent/mitigate this in future will be sent to all customers who contacted us during the incident. use existing tracker ticket is possible, but if time is exceeded, you may be required to open a new problem record with link to original incident. process diagram major incident handling process.vsdx major incident log the major incident log.xlsx is a list of all major incidents since october 2022. the completed reports can be found in cs global support - support leaders - major incident reports - all documents (sharepoint.com) major incident manager instructions the support major incident manager is accountable for the resolution of any major incidents communication during the incident mim posts to internal stakeholder/senior management teams chat during the incident - chat is named "retail solutions escalations (group chat for posting urgent customer issues)" mim sends management updates about the incident to the retail solutions escalations group teams chat every 2 hours (minimum) template for initial notification: summary including affected service/product: ticket number: customers affected: time of discovery: business impact: immediate actions: next update in: mim is a single point of contact (spoc) for escalations and major incidents if the mim is working with an incident, that must take priority over business as usual (bau) tasks until resolved. the mim is responsible for setting up a group chat with involved team/people who are trying to find the cause and resolve the mi. major incident report (story telling after the incident) a major incident report is for internal use (after the incident has been resolved, and within 1 week of it being resolved). the major incident report should be sent to appropriate distribution list, depending on the products and customers affected. you will need to get a root cause from the product owner assuming a software or infrastructure issue was the cause. when you are writing an incident report, you are telling a story. anyone who reads an incident report needs to understand what has happened, when and by which team. use timelines and team names. the template report to take a copy from is ci-000 (ca-xxxxx) major incident report template.docx which is in the folder of all previous major incident reports cs global support - support leaders - major incident reports key contacts for major incident managers in case of major incidents, these are the main contacts you can use to help investigate and resolve incidents (and these people may not be able to help, but should know who can if not) who is on out of hours shifts shifts are managed in a single shift app in ms teams ("retail solutions customer support" team). imagine development contacts as per imagine platform issues if other team members required or escalation required, contact matt warr ddd/riab development contacts: ddd backoffice: søren jansen backup: torben christensen ddd pos: rene andersen it-relation -
